snippet: Officials say all of the illnesses were believed to have been transmitted through contact with pigs.
abstract: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention reports a sharp rise in the number of swine flu cases, but decline to designate the uptick as an epidemic because there is no evidence of transmission between humans; number of people who have fallen ill with the virus since mid July stands at 152, though most cases have been mild.
lead_paragraph: Officials say all of the illnesses were believed to have been transmitted through contact with pigs.

headline.seo: C.D.C. Reports Jump in Mild Cases of Swine Flu
headline.main: C.D.C. Reports Sudden Rise in Mild Cases of Swine Flu
headline.print_headline: C.D.C. Reports Sudden Rise in Swine Flu Cases (All Mild)

keywords.value: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
